intro: Lasianthera dichrocarpa, commonly known as the two-colored sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows from a short, thick rhizome and has a low, spreading habit. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Lasianthera dichrocarpa is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
